io.hekate.messaging.broadcast

Interface BroadcastCallback<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - Base type of a messages.
    Functional Interface:
    This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.

    @FunctionalInterface
public interface BroadcastCallback<T>
    Callback for broadcast(...) operation.

    This interface can be used with the MessagingChannel.broadcast(Object, BroadcastCallback) method and will be notified as follows:

    • channel submits message to each of the target nodes in parallel
    • for each successful submission the onSendSuccess(Object, ClusterNode) method gets notified
    • for each failed submission the onSendFailure(Object, ClusterNode, Throwable) method gets notified
    • when message gets submitted to all nodes (either successfully or with a failure) then onComplete(Throwable, BroadcastResult) method gets called with an error parameter being null and BroadcastResult containing information about partial failures.

    Note: Implementations of this interface must be thread safe since its methods can be notified in parallel by multiple threads.

    See Also:
    MessagingChannel.broadcast(Object, BroadcastCallback), BroadcastResult

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void onComplete(Throwable err, BroadcastResult<T> result)
      Called when the broadcast operation gets completed either successfully or with an error.
      default void onSendFailure(T message, ClusterNode node, Throwable error)
      Called in case of a cluster node communication failure.
      default void onSendSuccess(T message, ClusterNode node)
      Called when message was successfully submitted to the cluster node.

    • Method Detail

      • onComplete

        void onComplete(Throwable err,
                BroadcastResult<T> result)
        Called when the broadcast operation gets completed either successfully or with an error.

        If operation completes with a fatal error (f.e channel is closed) then err parameter will hold the error cause and result parameter will be null. Otherwise err parameter will be null and result parameter will hold the broadcast operation result.

        Parameters:
        err - Error (null if operation was successful).
        result - Broadcast operation result (null if operation failed).

      • onSendSuccess

        default void onSendSuccess(T message,
                           ClusterNode node)
        Called when message was successfully submitted to the cluster node.

        Note that this method gets called while broadcast is still in progress. Final broadcast results are provided by the onComplete(Throwable, BroadcastResult) method. See the description of BroadcastCallback interface for the complete sequence of callback methods notification.

        Parameters:
        message - Message.
        node - Cluster node.

      • onSendFailure

        default void onSendFailure(T message,
                           ClusterNode node,
                           Throwable error)
        Called in case of a cluster node communication failure.

        Note that this method gets called while broadcast is still in progress. Final broadcast results are provided by the onComplete(Throwable, BroadcastResult) method. See the description of BroadcastCallback interface for the complete sequence of callback methods notification.

        Parameters:
        message - Message.
        node - Failed cluster node.
        error - Error cause.
